cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a fundamental problem of set approximation, which is a core topic in computer science. The use of group queries and conditional sampling suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-categories of data structures (cs.DS), information theory (cs.IT), and computational complexity (cs.CC). Additionally, the paper discusses the adaptive and non-adaptive algorithms, which are relevant to the sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper also discusses the natural family of allowed subsets, which correspond to intervals, indicating a possible connection to the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG).
